metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5188 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 60, Firefox ESR 60, and Firefox ESR52.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and wepresume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited torun arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60,Thunderbird < 52.9, Firefox ESR < 60.1, Firefox ESR < 52.9, and Firefox <61.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libmozjs-52-0 - 52.9.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.9.1-1').
